intro: Salix repens var. adscendens, commonly known as creeping willow, is a variant of the creeping willow species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its slender,匍匐的 stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. The leaves are typically oval or elliptical, with a smooth margin and a silvery underside. It produces catkins in early spring, which are its primary means of seed dispersal. This plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, streambanks, and disturbed areas.
